column1: good length at off stump, walks across the stumps and pushes to shrot fine. Turn already
good length at off stump, turns down the leg side and he tucks it off the back foot to deep square

...but they won't need anyone out in the field! Goes around the wicket, good length, pushed outside off, de Kock puts in a half-stride and checks his shot as the ball turns sharply and catches the outside edge
tossed up outside off, tries to turn it into the leg side, catches it on the pad, outside the line
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, gets on top of the bounce and pushes with the turn into the leg side
gonna be some day for the batters today. Good length, drifted in at off stump, pitches and takes big turn past the outside edge as du Plessis tries to defend
good length at off, hangs back this time and pushes it through the covers
flighted full outside off, pushed down to long-off
good length outside off, front foot defence
good length outside off, drives it on the up to sweeper cover
full at off stump, pushed to mid-on
good length, outside off, spins back sharply as he walks across and defends off the back foot
good length outside off, gets slow and miscues the sweep, inside edge to short fine's right
back of a length at off stump, goes right back and tucks it to deep square
flat and back of a length at the pads, that's the easiest ball he's played today. Bunted to deep square
back of a length, pitches on leg and spins further away
overcompensates. Pushes it wide, drops it short and he slaps that between point and short third man
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
full and tails slightly in from off stump, driven past the non-striker and Williamson parries it towards mid-on with a dive
good length, swung in at middle stump, defends off the back foot
good length, shaped in at middle stump, defended to midwicket
full at middle, pushed back to the bowler with soft hands
close! Back of a length, swinging in, Amla expects the shape away and shoulders arms. It catches him at middle stump line but he's well back and it clips the top of his pads. Not out.
good length, catches the pads on the attempted flick and goes through to the keeper
back of a length at middle, bunted to square leg off the back foot
back of a length outside off, punched on the up, middles it, straight to covers
good length, angled into the pads, tucked to fine leg's left off the thigh
good length, starts at middle stump and goes on the with the angle, not able to find the shape away so far
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to point off the back foot
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
good length at middle stump, shuffles across slightly and brings those quick wrists into the play to whip it fine past the keeper
back of a length outside off, slight shape back in, but safely left
135 kph, full at middle stump, driven on the up, slightly uppishly but lands well in front of a diving Boult and slips through to mid-on from under him
back of a length outside off, pushed to third man off the back foot
back of a length at middle, stands on one toe, gets the other nice and high and turns it past short fine. Too short on a slow pitch, that ball
back of a length outside off, lets it go with the angle
good length, angled in at off stump, walks across and defends it back at the bowler
111 kph, slower ball, floated full at off stump, driven to mid-on
back of length off cutter outside off, waits for it and drops it into the off side
good length, angled in at the pads, pushed to deep square
oooh! Rolls his fingers on it and it spits at du Plessis from a good length and catches him on the right thumb
good length, another slower ball, waits for it and pushes watchfully to mid-on
116 kph, back of a length outside off, tries to turn it into the leg side, but can't get his wrists to power it properly. Pushed back to the bowler
116 kph, off cutter, full at off stump, driven to extra cover
good length at middle, puts a short stride in and whips it behind square to pick the long leg boundary
118 kph, back of a length outside off, sits in the pitch slightly, pushed to point off the back foot
what a shot that is. 112 kph, good length outside off, Amla opens his arms, waits for it to arrive and goes through the line, inside-out over covers
138 kph, short and wide, chopped in front of point
131 kph, back of a length and angled across the corridor, lets it go
112 kph, good length at off stump, covers the off stump with a big stride and defends it to point
135 kph, back of a length outside off and he's punched this expertly through point, opening the face at the last moment. Waited for the quick one and put it away.
112 kph, back of a length, cuts back in from outside off, defended to point
113 kph, good length outside off, he's on the back foot early, can only push it back feebly into the leg sdie
108 kph, good length outside off, waits for it to turn back in and punches on the up to long-on
109 kph, good length outside off, wants to run this down to third man but it hits him high on the bat after pitching and falls at his feet
full at middle stump, thumped past the bowler to long-on
110 kph, good length off cutter outside off, turned to midwicket off the front foot
109 kph, full off cutter outside off, driven into the gap between the covers fielders to bring up the fifty partnership
full at middle stump, tries to punch it to long-on, hits it into the pitch and it the bowler can catch that off the bounce to his right
full at off stump, tries to whip it into the leg side with the turn, inside edge onto pad
good length outside off, pushed to point off the front foot
full at off stump, du Plessis has gone down early to paddle this. Takes it on the full and turns it nicely to long leg's right
good length, tossed up outside off, goes for the sweep and gets struck on the pads, but he had walked well across and was outside the line
good length, turns in at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
good length at off stump, nice and low again as he gets more bat on this paddle sweep than the previous one, but Boult puts in a good dive after running 20 yards to his right from long leg
90 kph, good length outside off, pushed to square leg off the front foot
good length outside off, gets a stride across the stumps and hits it to deep midwicket
short and wide, chopped to sweeper cover off the back foot
109 kph, off cutter, full at off stump, punched to long-on
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
full toss floated at middle stump, closes the face early on his flick and gets a leading edge to point
classy shot. Good length outside off, it's not quick this ball, and it's low - knee height. But he hangs back and punches off the back foot in front of deep square leg
full at the pads, times the flick nicely this time, straight to deep square
full at off stump, and they're making a staple out of this paddle. Amla gets low this time and walks across the stumps to ramp this fine, uppishly
good length at middle, pushed straight to square leg, and Amla has been sent back after taking off for a run. Has to put in a dive but the ball misses the stumps anyway
full at the pads, flicked to deep square
tossed up outside off, forward defence

they're going to have to reconsider the ramp! Amla walks across once more, but this time he's pushed it flat and back of a length. Amla is still moving as it arrives at him with all stumps exposed. In the end, he can't get down fast, or stay still to play with a straight bat. Gets hurried on the ramp, takes it on the inside edge outside off and it clips off stump...in fact, it's hit middle, but only the bail on the left has lit up
full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
drifted full at the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, hangs back and dabs it to short third man
good length at off stump, pushed flat, defended into the off side
back of a length, teasing line, slight turn, du Plessis is tempted, but pulls out of offering a shot
good length at off stump, pushed off the back foot to long-on
good length at middle stump, gets on top of the bounce, cuts the spin and executes a nice sweep shot
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, shuffles across to push it into the leg side, but this one holds its line and slides past the outside edge
good length outside off stump, not quite to the pitch, but manages to control the sweep shot
fired in flat at a good length at leg stump from around the wicket, he goes back and catches it on the pad
good length at off stump, bounces sharply as he plays a back foot defence
arm ball, good length at off stump, thick inside edge on his forward defence
back of a length at middle, goes back and pushes it past the bowler towards long-on
good length at off stump, punched back to the bowler
good length outside off, walks across and ramps it into the leg sie
full outside off, driven to long-off
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off at a length, forward defence

tossed up outside off, it slides past the outside edge on his attempted cover drive and they're appealing to both umpires - there was no real sound before Ronchi took the bails off. Not out say the umpires. It's been reviewed for caught behind...hotspot shows no edge, and snicko shows no indicator of an edge either. The decision stands - not-out.
dropped short on the pads, waits an eternity before turning it off his hips to deep square
full at leg stump, pushed into the leg side with soft hands
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-on
flighted full at off stump, driven to long-off
full at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
pushed across from around the wicket, too full and Duminy gets down to paddle it fine
short of a length, not much turn, tucks it from outside off into the leg side from the crease
gets down to sweep again but this one has slightly more turn and he gets a top-edge on the sweep that goes to backward square leg
good length ball, presses forward and blocks into the covers region. Duminy takes off for a single but is sent back
floated up and angled in on leg stump, du Plessis presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
tidly line and length, angling in on middle and leg, du Plessis presents a straight bat and defends it back to Santner
shorter in length, punched off the backfoot back to the bowler
gets the length all wrong, nearly gets it to bounce twice, it's that short. Pulled away to deep midwicket
length ball, tucked off the front foot just wide of midwicket and they take a quick single
floats it up too much and offers up a full toss that is whipped away into the leg side
nicely flighted outside off, comes forward and clips it into the leg side, past the diving mid-on fielder
flighted outside off, driven down to long-off for a single

chance, put down at midwicket. It was a length ball and spinning in sharply to Duminy who cannot keep the attempted tuck along the ground. Guptill gets there and dives forward but lets the ball slip as he dives forward with the momentum
defended back to the bowler
floated up and angling in on middle. Du Plessis goes inside-out and lofts it over extra cover. Sweeper cover runs to his right and cuts it off
driven through covers
good length outside off, tries to ramp it but does not get low enough and hits it back on to his body
too much flight and bowls a full toss that is pushed down to long-on
tossed up outside off, driven down to long-off
eased down to long-on off the front foot
length ball, spinning away outside off and it is tucked comfortably off the pads into the midwicket region
floats up a tempter outside off and du Plessis leans forward and crunches a cover drive, wide of the short cover fielder. No chance for Southee to get that
sharp turn from the good length area, keeps a bit low and du Plessis presents a straight bat and nudges it to mid-on
length ball outside off, cuts back in sharply and Duminy sticks the bat out with no feet, gets an inside edge that misses the stumps
offers up some width outside off on this length ball and du Plessis steers it wide of the backward point fielder. Guptill runs across and slides to field it
Duminy defends this length ball and the bat face closes slightly as he completes the defence and the ball goes off the outer part of the blade to the right of Boult
fullish ball, commits early on to the front foot and ends up walking into the forward push as the ball goes off the outer part of the blade to the third man region
length on off, holding its line, opens the bat face from the crease and guides it to point
short of good length, pushed across just outside off. Du Plessis drops it into the covers region and takes off for a quick single even as the fielder there runs in and swoops down to collect it
slower full ball, off-cutter at 107.9kph, nudged into the leg side
full and wide outside off, around a set of stumps away from off-stump, holding its line, not bothered with by the batsman
fuller ball, no pace again, just 106 clicks and angling in on off, defended off the front foot
short ball, sits up nicely for Duminy as he swivels around and pulls it to deep square leg
length ball, whips it away off the pads behind square on the leg side
opens the bat face and runs this down towards third man
short of a length and angling in, tucked off the pads to deep fine leg for an easy single
length ball, beats him with pace as it jags back in sharply. Du Plessis gets a nasty inside edge on to the inner thigh
stays leg side of the ball and flays this length ball through the off side but cannot get it past the diving cover fielder

nicely controlled. Du Plessis uses the angle on that one nicely to his advantage. Boult angles one in at pace and du Plessis just picks it up off the pads and chips it over the fielder at mid-on as the ball sails well over the man there and goes to the boundary. And that brings up Faf's fifty
arches back and runs this down to square third man
short of good length on off, defended towards covers
slower ball, tucked to midwicket

backs away to give himself a chance to free his arms. And comes down the track to get on top of that. It was another off-cutter and takes an age to come on but du Plessis does well to take a good stride towards it and pulls it to deep midwicket. Nice control on that shot as well
short of a length and not much pace at all, just 112 kph, and it is tucked to midwicket from the crease
fuller ball, dipping in late outside off. And that is just 98kph, it is crashed through extra cover.
angling in on the pads, turns it away with the angle to deep fine leg
short of a length, tucked away into the leg side, through the midwicket region
short ball, wide outside off, punched firmly off the backfoot out to the right of sweeper cover
width on offer outside off. It does not sit up from the short of a length area as much as he perhaps expected as the ball sneaks from beneath the blade and goes to the wicketkeeper
advances down the track and Neesham drags the length back, makes the late adjustment and stabs it out to third man with an open bat face
opens the face of his bat and guides it to third man. The fielder is slightly square and he runs to his left and cuts it off
rolls his fingers over the seam and sends down an off-cutter that cuts away and beats the attempted cut
short ball, Duminy arches back to negotiate the bounce and opens the face of his bat to guide it down to third man
width on offer outside off, length, guides it to backward point
opens his arms as he sees width outside off and tries to cut but it is not short enough and he bottom-edges it hard into the ground
sticks to the wide outside off channel and this time Duminy punches it off the backfoot in front of point and they take off for a very quick single
fuller and just outside off, around the fourth stump channel, drills it off the front foot down to long-on

Dragged on. The wide outside off channel pays. Duminy opens his blade as he sees this one pitch around a set of stumps outside off and tries to cut it away. But he does not account for the late movement. Cuts back in late after pitching and gets the inside edge as the ball goes into the stumps.
front foot defence, inside edge to the pads
tossed up and angled in on middle and leg. Defended

good length and spinning away, comes forward and drops it into the covers region. Guptill is stationed there and du Plessis takes off for a single. He is sent back and a direct hit would have seen the back of him. He was halfway down and has to put in a desperate dive
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
backs away to make room for himself and cuts this one spinning away to deep point
tossed up and fullish on middle and leg, comes forward and blocks to the bowler
presents the full face of his bat and lets it come with the angle on to leg stump channel before pushing it to mid-on
full and wide outside off, steered to third man
fuller ball, almost a legbreak from the side of the hand, du Plessis presents the full face of his bat and works it towards mid-off
nudged away to midwicket
length ball on the fourth-stump channel, opens the bat face and steers it to point
shorter ball, swivels around and pulls. Not much pace on the delivery or off the wicket and he cannot time it well as he gets it away to midwicket
short ball, this one's at 130 clicks and he is done in by lack of pace. Gets hit on the shoulder as he completes the shot early
shifts back in the crease and tucks this away to the leg side
strides forward and drives this fuller ball to long-off
du Plessis lays into a cover drive as he gets the front leg out of the way and pummels this but he cannot beat the fielder there as he makes a diving save
fuller ball again, cover fielder dives again and though it is not driven as hard this time, it gets past his dive
defended down the pitch. No run there
short of a length on the stumps, opens the bat face and steers it to backward point
punched out to the right of sweeper cover
short and wide, slaps it hard off the backfoot, there is a man guarding the sweeper cover fence and the ball goes straight to him
full and outside off, driven out to sweeper cover
short ball, angling down leg, de Villiers does not even have to duck as the angle carries this one away from him, to his left
width on offer outside off, waits for it in the crease and runs it down to third man

chipped straight to midwicket. Length ball, gets stuck in the surface and does not really come on. It was an off-cutter and du Plessis comes forward and tries to turns it away into the leg side. But he is not in the best of positions and he fails to keep it along the ground as he fails to get his head completely down while playing it
bang on off, moves away to make room for himself and cuts to point
stays in the crease and waits for this one to come on before turning it away to square leg
opens the bat face by using his wrists and cannot beat backward point
fetches a sweep from outside off as this one comes on at a fuller length and plays it to deep midwicket
backs away and uses the depth of the crease to this length ball on the stumps before punching it away to long-off

Miller sweeps again but this time he does not keep it along the ground. Gives it too much power and it goes hard and flat to the fielder at deep midwicket. Brownlie snaffles a superb catch. It was coming on to him quickly and dipping on him but he judges the dive to perfection as he gets forward, gets low enough and pouches it smartly
back of a length in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce and turns it to third man with an open face
good length outside off, defended solidly off the front foot
back of a length outside off, nips back in sharply as he opens the face and hits high on the bat
back of a length outside off, tries to squeeze it down to third man as it nips back in, keeper and point converge in the gully area
goes straight on outside off from a good length and this time he can play it to third man comfortably
back of a length in the corridor, angled into AB who gets on his toes to try and turn it into the leg side but is too early and it lands in the bowler's vicinity
rolls his fingers on a good length ball at off stump, pushed to point with an open face
rolls his fingers again, this time he pushes it wide outside off and beats the outside edge on the attempted cover drive
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
around the wicket, back of a length and climbing at him in the corridor, contorts himself to dab it down to third man
slower ball at off stump, sits into the good length and catches a thick outside edge high on the bat, straight to that slip fielder
good length at off stump, pushed to point off the front foot
good length outside off, punched on the up to sweeper
138 kph, good length, angled in from outside off, goes for the drive on the up but plays inside the line and is beaten on the outside edge
good length outside off, chopped off the front foot to point
good length outside off, dabbed to third man, away from the body
back of a length, angled in at the ribs, looking to run it down to third man but awkwardly defends it and instinctively throws a kick out as the ball drops behind him...safely
slower ball, back of a length in the corridor, this one climbs and then dips as it goes past the outside edge
full at the pads, pushed out to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, pushed on the up to sweeper cover
slower bouncer at his chest, gets his head out of the way as he waits for it and keeps the pull down
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
flighted full outside off, driven straight to covers
good length at off stump, goes back and just about gets bat to push it back to the bowler
drops it short outside off, gets back and chops it past short third man...first boundary in 12 overs
full at middle stump, pushed towards long-on, Patel puts in a dive and stops it

that is dreadful running. Good length on the pads, he's got good bat on his push, it's straight to Taylor at square leg. de Villiers has called for a run that was never on. Pretorious is nowhere close as a gentle throw comes in on the bounce and the bowler flicks the bails off. There was slight hesitation from him, but he trusted his partner and went through
good length, pushed flat outside off, front foot defence
back of a length outside off, sliced off the back foot to sweeper
full off cutter thrown wide, driven sweetly, straight to sweeper cover
good length, sliding into the pads, would've been four if he got a bat on that attempted tickle, but it thuds into his pads as he reaches out at it
good length at off stump, feet are rooted, bat is away from the body as he pushes hard at this and gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
back of a length slower ball, angled across off, defended to cover
back of a length outside off, slower ball, sits up nicely for his cut. He middles it but point dives to his right and catches it one the bounce, one-handed
good length at off stump, spins and bounces sharply, catches the top of the inside edge and flies past Ronchi down the leg side
good length at middle stump, gets on one knee and sweeps to Taylor, who has to stretch backwards this time as it bounces over him
full outside off stump, shuffles across, driven to long-on
105 kph, faster one at middle stump, turns it off his ankles to deep square
good length outside off, hangs back, mistimes his punch to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, swatted away on the up to sweeper
back of a length cutter at off stump, pushed to point off the front foot
good length, leg cutter outside off, squares him up as he throws his hands at it and is beaten on the outside edge
good length, angled into the pads, flicked to deep square leg
good length at off stump, driven to covers
back of a length at off stump, shoveled off the hips to midwicket
good length outside off, pushes forward and taps it with the turn to long-on
arm ball outside off at a good length, hangs back and pushes with soft hands to sweeper cover
loopy good length ball outside off, doesn't spin back enough to catch him in line on his attempted sweep, appeal and not-out
good length at middle stump, pushed off the back foot to midwicket
102 kph, faster one at off stump, thick outside edge to deep midwicket
good length outside off, dips on him fast. He isn't to the pitch as he flicks and it floats for a while before landing wide of midwicket
full at off stump, opens the face too much on his cover drive and it rolls to short third man
looped up, full at off stump, driven neatly to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed to covers
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-off
good length, angled in at middle stump, uses his wrists to push it inside-out to covers
back of a length outside off, punched to covers off the back foot
good length at middle stump, reverse sweep and that's a half-attempt at a stop at backward point. Nailed that off the middle
good length, angled across off stump, forward defence
full on the pads, whipped to long-on
full at off stump, puts a big stride across and flicks it to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length, pushed flat at middle stump, goes back, gets cramped, but manages to punch it down to long-off with the full face offered
drifted full at the pads, dropped into the open leg side with soft hands
drops short at middle stump, hangs back, swivels slightly and pulls it powerfully over the midwicket boundary
floated in at middle stump, puts in a stride and pushes it into the leg side, where the only fielder in the circle is at short fine
drifted in at middle, and he uses the angle to pick the leg side infield again
full at middle stump, driven back to the bowler
78 kph, slow, short and wide, hangs back and chops it to sweeper cover
full slower ball outside off, picks the cutter and turns it to deep square leg
good length, angled in at the pads, steps out and cramps himself. Can only push it back to the bowler
slower ball, dropped short outside off, plenty of time to bring the bat down hard on it - he does. Pulled straight to deep midwicket
short at off stump, the rib-cage attack might not work so well now that he's set. Winds up and slaps it wide of long-on
bouncer at middle stump, goes for the hook, slightly out of control, one bounce to fine leg
107 kph, slower length ball at off stump, too short for this pitch, waits for it and lifts it to deep midwicket's left on the up
full slower ball outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover to bring up fifty of the partnership
how did he do that? Slower ball, back of a length angled across, but he's hit this against the angle, on the up, no feet, straight over the bowler's head
misses the yorker, low full toss at the pads, flicked to deep midwcket's left. Didn't try to hit that hard

...but he's certainly tried to clobber this. Comes around the wicket, bowls it full, angled in at the batsman. He wants to slog this way over midwicket, but it catches him on the pads and clatters into middle stump
slower ball at yorker length outside off, stretches forward and digs it out to sweeper cover
full and angled in at middle stump, puts in a short stride and tucks it to deep midwicket to keep the strike
full faster one outside off, leans into it and connects the premeditated reverse sweep. Gets it square, sweeper gets across, puts in a slide and mucks about but can't hold onto it in the end
good length at middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket off the front foot
poor fielding. Short and wide outside off, feeble cut shot that backward point charges at and completely misses. Can't recover as it slides into the boundary
good length at middle, flicked to deep midwicket
good length, pitches on leg stump and turns well wide, off the gloves and straight to short fine
good length at middle, pushed to deep midwicket off the front foot
good length at the pads, pushed into the infield on the leg side and the bowler can't keep that down
yorker, tails in from outside off, tries to bludgeon this but gets a thick inside edge to short fine
slower ball outside off, good length, chopped to Taylor at point who is close in. He shies at the non-strikers but the bowler is in front of the stump and cuts its travel at the stumps
slower ball, dropped short outside off, waits and waits before unleashing a full-blooded swing to swat it over deep midwicket
low full toss outside off, walks across the stumps, gets slow and sweeps it to deep midwicket

what an absolute beauty from Parnell. Slower ball, full at middle stump, he knew it was going to be slow. A small stride forward, gets right under it, meets it at the bounce and lifts it sweetly over the bowler with a straight bat
good length, sliding down the leg, attempted paddle sweep, missed

slower ball at off stump, this is the opposite of that last shot from Parnell . Loses his shape completely as he steps out, slices it just over Taylor at point who runs backwards in hope but can't get there
yorker, wide down the leg side
low full toss at leg stump, backs away and punches it past AB, and long-on is nowhere near that as it flies to his right
a length ball outside off, slower ball, but enough to indulge that big arc. Gets it slightly off the bottom but he has put enough power on this to just evade Neesham at deep midwicket
yorker at leg stump, squeezed off the toes to deep midwicket
113 kph, attempted slower ball pitches on a good length at the wide marker and spins away
ooooooh! He's anticipated the angle across, is ready for the reverse ramp. But Boult has dug it in short. No problem - waits for it, stays on his feet and pushes it between keeper and short third man
goes for it again, but is forced to reach out as the ball is fuller and turns past him to beat the bat
goes around, bowls a length ball at off stump, he makes room and slaps it on the up, flat, one bounce to sweeper
yorker outside off, jammed out past covers and sweeper has to run to his left

overpitched outside off and he doesn't even need to move his feet to get to this. Might as well have been a golf ball placed perfectly for a nice swing through the line, because that's what he's done. Straight over the bowler
low full toss outside off, just wide enough for him to mistime it and hit straight to covers on the bounce
low full toss, angled in at the pads, whipped to fine leg
low full toss outside off, looks for the gap between extra cover and mid-off, but doesn't have enough bat on it. Williamson slides to his left and keeps it to one

yorker outside off, jammed into the off side, teases the sweeper cover fielder who puts in a nice throw as AB comes back for the second and finds that his partner wasn't thinking along the same lines. Run out by a long way
yorker at middle stump first up and he just manages to get bat on this. Inside edge flies down to fine leg, who puts in a slide to pull it back. It's only one, Guptill's hamstrings aren't fully back
back of a length and shaping away from the corridor, pushed off the back foot to point
back of a length, angled in at off stump from the corridor, inside edge onto pad
back of a length outside off, chopped to cover-point
142 kph, full at off stump, flicks across the line, straight to mid-on
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length at off stump, pushes forward and gets a thick inside edge on his forward defence
full and angled across off stump, gets in a nice stride and punches firmly to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, timed nicely into the off side but covers puts in a dive
full and wide outside off, chases it and the bat turns in his hand as he goes for the drive
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
good length at middle stump, solidly behind it as he defends off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, ball hits the bat hard and it thumps into his pat off the pitch
144 kph, misses the yorker, full toss on the pads and easily flicked away
good length at off stump, defended with an angled bat
full at leg stump, inside edges the flick onto his pads
another inside edge on the attempted flick, and this time it's tickled through to de Kock down the leg! Was a poor ball, fired down the leg and his nervous innings has come to an end
full and wide outside off, way too wise to entice Williamson into a stroke

straight drive, driven too straight. The bowler gets down and tries to get a hand to it but misses and the ball crashes into the stumps at the non-striker's end even as the batsman makes his way back after backing up
flashes his blade outside off, good pace from Parnell - 138 clicks - and tries to punch this one through the off side but gets cramped for room as there isn't enough width. Was beaten by pace as well
length ball, tucked off the pads through midwicket
full and wide, pushed across a set of stumps outside off and Williamson squirts it out to third man with an open face of the bat to get off the mark

oh, shot! That's a cracker of a shot. Short ball, width on offer outside off. Guptill picks the length early, gets in position early, rocks back and lays into a pull shot that goes a good mile into the grassbanks across the deep midwicket fence
defended off the front foot into the off side
fullish length ball on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
short of a length and angling in on leg, not much bounce, blocked with a straight bat back towards the bowler
good length and angling in, tucked with the angle and off the pads to deep fine leg
short ball, angled in again, good pace - 140 clicks - and it is ducked under
length ball, angling in, defended with the angle towards mid-on
flashes hard at the sight of some width outside off. It is short of a length and Guptill flays it square of the wicket with a half-angled bat, beats point comfortably and screams into the boundary
short of a length outside off, runs it down to third man with an open bat face
back of a length outside off, stands tall and  punches it past covers off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
wide outside off, puts in a short stride and slashes it behind point on the up
good length outside off stump, front foot defence
full outsie off stump, gets forward and drives straight to mid-off
closes the bat face early to this fuller ball and skews it off the leading edge into the off side
defended off the backfoot to the off side
shuffles across and tucks this length ball to midwicket
skidding on and drifting away on middle, Williamson defends off the outer half of the blade to the off side
short and wide and Williamson rocks back and lays into a cut shot, pierces the gap square of the wicket
good length on off, presses forward and pushes with hard hands, finds the outside edge as the ball goes to square third man
short of a length and outside off, punched off the backfoot and picks out point
fullish length ball, around a set of stumps outside off, Williamson waits for it and is late on the defence as he chops the ball into the surface and it goes behind the stumps
good length on off, gets a good stride across and dabs it with soft hands to drop it in front of backward point
fuller length, angles it in from a set of stumps outside off and Williamson quietly defends it straight back to the bowler

nicely done. Fires a tempter outside off, full and well outside off, forcing Williamson to reach out for it. And it is a cross-seam delivery as well which means it is slower and comes late on to Williamson who drives away from the body. Gets an inside edge and the ball misses the stumps and goes fine
pitched up on the stumps, drilled to midwicket off the front foot
worked to midwicket off the backfoot
strides across to this length ball and bunts it into the covers region
clipped off the pads into square leg
comes down the track but the delivery is on leg stump and he does not have enough room, nudges it away into the leg side
sweeps and gets it square enough. There is a fielder at long leg and he runs across and slides across to his left, but the ball deflects off his palm and into the boundary
short of a length outside off,waits for it to come on before opening the face of his bat and working it to square third man
length ball, uses the angle to nudge it to midwicket
good length on off, defended off the front foot
sprays it down the leg side. Poor bowling. Full and easy pickings for Guptill who picks it off the pads and clips it fine
short ball, comes at around waist height for Guptill who swivels around and times his pull to perfection as the ball soars over the deep backward square leg boundary
full and very wide outside off, left alone
back of a length on the stumps, whipped away into deep midwicket
full and outside off, leans forward and drives to mid-off

deliberately opens the bat face late to work it off the outside edge. Nicely floated up and loopy delivery outside off, drawing the batsman forward. Guptill opens the bat face late to work it fine enough as the ball goes away to the third man fence
floats it up outside off and Guptill presents the full face of his bat to launch it over long-off. Does not get all his weight behind that but good enough to carry all the way
comes forward and crunches a drive out to sweeper cover. Moves on to 49
tries to stay back to this length ball and turn it away off the pads into the leg side. But he misses as the ball angles in to him sharply and raps him on the pad. Would have missed leg
good length on off, stays in the crease and knocks it off the backfoot to long-on. Jogs the single and celebrates his comeback with a half-century. Soaks in a warm applause from the crowd

Williamson comes down the track early and stays outside the crease. The bowler ovecompensates by dragging his length back too much. Still comes on a t a short enough length for Williamson who pulls it with authority past deep midwicket
tucked off the pads behind square
short and wide, slapped hard off the backfoot to sweeper cover
fullish on off, tries to squirt it away by opening the bat face late but cannot beat backward point
fuller, outside off, driven off the front foot to mid-off
pushed down to long-on off the front foot

appeal for lbw, given by umpire Reiffel. Williamson opts to not review it. Wouldn't have helped him as that would have probably hit middle and off. Williamson gets down to sweep but it is not full enough to sweep. Pitching on middle and leg and turning away and gets rapped on the pads
gets a googly first up, Taylor picks the variation and tucks it behind square
fuller ball, gets the front leg out of the way and drills this hard into the turn before it goes straight to Tahir
driven to the right of extra cover who puts in a dive and pushes it back towards Tahir

shot, what a shot! That made a sweet sound. He has absolutely laid into a pull shot. Too short and coming on flat and comes on quickly, at pace to Guptill who rocks back and dispatches it a mile over deep midwicket
full and angling in, tucked off the pads to the on side
good length ball, comes forward and defends into the off side
going down leg, clipped away off the pads to deep midwicket
fullish length outside off, leans forward and punches it out to sweeper cover
drops his wrists late as he opens them to run this down to third man
short of good length ball, attacking line, punched off the backfoot to long-on
full and wide, driven wide of long-off
sliding in on a fuller length with the arm, clipped off the toes to the right of the bowler
driven to covers off the front foot
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
fuller ball, driven to covers off the front foot
fullish and attacking off, comes forward and blocks into the off side

lbw given by umpire Wayne Knights. Reviewed by Guptill. And it's missing. What a review by New Zealand. Short of good length ball, angling in to Guptill. The batsman is trying to flick it away into the leg side but he is a long way down the track, outside the crease and he is struck quite high on the knee roll as he misses the flick. HotSpot confirms no edge involved but the height is too much and ball-tracking shows it's going over leg

almost a caught and bowled. Guptill closes the face of his bat early as he tries to flick this one away and the ball goes off the leading edge towards the bowler and just goes past his outstretched hands
tucked to backward square leg
fuller ball, defended to mid-off
fuller ball, clipped into the leg side
flighted on the stumps, turned away into the leg side
defended off the front foot

grip and turn outside off. Comfortably beats the outside edge of the batsman and now there is a review for stumping. The backfoot of the batsman came off even as the keeper was taking off the bails but he has managed to plant it back in time
comes forward and pushes this straight into the hands of Tahir who fires a throw at the keeper's end even as the batsman scampers back. He doesn't hit
pitched up on the middle and leg channel, defended to the right of Tahir off the front foot
floated up on off, tries to drive but does not entirely get hold of it and it is intercepted by the cover fielder
fuller length on the stumps, Guptill takes a stride forward and chips is straight back over the bowler's head by presenting the full face of his bat. Comfortably lofted for a straight boundary
short of a length outside off, punched into the off side
full and on the pads, picks it off them and whips it slightly uppishly through the midwicket region
full on off, comes forward and drunches a drive but straight to the fielder at mid-off
full and angling in on middle and leg, closes the face of his bat a tad and he pushes it off the outer half of the blade back to the bowler

goes through with the lofted drive again and how effortlessly he does it. Full and in the slot, sees mid-off inside the circle and presents the full face of his bat. Times it to perfection and gets it well over the fielder at mid-off who jumps up with outstretched hands
good length at off stump, angled bat on the forward defence, spins past the outside edge
flipper, good length at middle stump, hurriedly pushed back to the bowler
full at off stump, driven to long-off
full at off stump, pushed effortless to long-off
full at middle stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, turning away slightly. Once again it's the angled bat that comes to meet it, this time with connection
good length, angled in at off stump, pushes at it with hard hands, then takes one hand off as it gets a leading edge and just flies past short extra cover
full at middle stump, defended to midwicket
137 kph, back of a length at middle, jumps to turn it through square leg
full, angled in at middle, offers the full face and defends solidly to mid-off
good length outside off, tries to drive on the up, bat turns in his hand and it bobbles towards mid-off and Guptill trusts his legs to make it across
low full toss outside off, meets the ball late on the cover drive and ends up slicing it to the right of point, who dives and parries it to cover
good length outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full at middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
full at middle stump, driven back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, yorks himself but jams it square past slip
back of a length at off stump, executes a nice late cut but Rabada dives to his left at backward point
googly, pitches at a good length outside off, he picks it, makes room and punches it to covers
back of a length outside off, sliced to cover-point
bouncer outside off, goes for the ramp through third man, beaten
back of a length outside off, sits up nicely for an authoritative punch on the up and he connects. There's no sweeper
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on
good length at off stump, defended to covers
full toss at the knees, angled down the leg, helped along fine. Poor bowling.
good length outside off, rolls his fingers on it, defended to point
back of a length at off stump, awkwardly chops it down to third man
short and wide, tries to throw his hands at this, put there's no pace off the pitch and he gets it into the leg side off the bottom of the bat

doesn't get pace off the pitch this time as well, but there's power on this back foot punch. Back of a length outside off, slightly early through the shot, it's aerial, but it's graceful and it flies past extra cover
back of a length at off stump, punched to sweeper cover
129 kph, bouncer at middle stump sits in the pitch and dips as it goes through to the keeper
good length on the pads, clips it with great timing and it wheels to the boundary
full and angled into the pads, short stride, gets the bat in front of pad and punches it to long-on
oooh, good bouncer. It's well-directed and has Taylor scrambling, but it's spongy bounce and he has enough time in the end to keep it down
good length at the pads, raps him on the pad as he tries to turn it fine
141kph, back of a length outside off, chopped to third man's right
another bouncer at the body, another unconvincing response - this time half takes his eyes off the ball and fends away from the body, it goes through square leg
good length outside off, chopped to third man
full outside off, reaches out and times this square drive nicely, but Duminy puts in a dive at point to deny him a hundred off that ball
short and angled down the leg, pulls it straight to fine leg
short and wide, expansive cut, but no timing on it and it rolls out to the sweeper
full outside off, throws everything he has at it, but he doesn't use his wrists enough and it lands one bounce in front of the sweeper
short and wide, doesn't miss out this time. Back and across in a flash and swatted past Duminy who has no chance this time
good length at off stump, pushed past short midwicket
back of a length at middle, tries to flick it down to fine leg, catches it on the thigh guard
back of a length on the pads, helped with the angle to fine leg
bouncer at middle stump, pulled imperially to deep square leg to bring up a century on return. His 12th in ODIs
back of a length at off stump, tries to drop and run, but he's too eager and does neither right
full at off stump, streaky outside edge down to third man
good length at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
bouncer outside leg stump, ducks under it and it flies over his left shoulder, 50-50 decision on wide there...not given
short and wide, goes hard at it and gets a thick outside edge to third man
good length at off stump from around the wicket, punched to long-off on the up
short at off stump, hangs back and connects the pull shot nicely, but straight to deep square
back of a length outside off, cuts back in slightly, the room got lesser and lesser as he went for the cut and the result is a thick under-edge past the keeper
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
back of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
good length, slower ball at off stump, defended off the front foot
low full toss at middle, driven to long-on
full at off stump, no feet as he goes for the drive, inside edge onto pad
full at middle stump, drives it past the bowler to mid-off
good length outside off, spits up on him as he pushes forward and defends. Thick outside edge to short third man
good length at off stump, defended to point
steps out, not to the pitch, but gets behind this off stump ball and defends solidly
googly, spins back sharply from outside off, he hasn't picked this at all and has to squeeze it out from above off stump, straight to third man
slow, good length at off stump, waits and watches closely before bringing out the blade to defend
another googly, not picked yet again, trapped in the crease and it's a loud appeal, but the ball pitched at off-and-middle and would have gone down
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
good length outside off, exerts a little on a well-timed forward push and gets it past point
slower bouncer at middle stump, hangs back and taps it on the head to fine leg
back of a length at off stump, runs it down to third man off the back foot
143 kph, bouncer at middle stump, slams the Silver Fern on his helmet as he takes his eyes off the ball to while hooking this
good length at off stump, tentative push and soft hands on this forward defence
full at off stump, driven to a tumbling extra cover fielder
goes for the flipper, drops it short at middle, and Guptill will hit these over midwicket any day of the year. Flat and into the advertising boards
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
full at the pads, turned to short fine
full at middle stump, dropped into the off side to steal a single as AB fails to pick up the ball running in from covers
full at middle stump, whipped to long-on
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide, and he'll be disappointed to have cut this straight to the covers fielder
short and wide again, beats the outside edge on the attempted cut
back of a length at middle, back foot defence
good length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off's left
yorker at off stump, dug out to deep cover
full at off stump, driven to short extra cover
good length, dipping at off stump, happy to defend
good length at off stump, pushed to point
full and down the leg side, gets a boot on the attempted sweep
full at off stump, driven to cover
shot! Wow, what glory in that shot. Tossed up outside off, he's got a stride in before it lands, waits for it, makes room and lifts it off the pitch over the extra cover boundary
good length at middle, clipped into the leg side
good length at middle, punched to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to long-on
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length slower ball outside off, waits for it and turns it down to third man
drops it short at middle stump, he stays put, gives it a half-stride and lifts it easily over the long leg boundary
full at off stump, pushed across the line to mid-on, head falling into the off side
good length at the pads, flicked to fine leg's left
good bouncer. Starts outside off, rises towards his neck and he has to sway away - and does so nicely
low full toss at off stump, mistimes the cover drive to extra cover's right
short and wide, happily accepted offering. Leans back and slots it past the diving backward point fielder
134 kph, bouncer outside off, has time to shift his weight behind and keep his eyes on the ball, but it's too wide and too high to get a connection on it

bouncer at middle stump, and this time he has to jump up to deal with it - once again, fended weakly into the leg side. Third time that he's fending in the the direction of where a short leg would have been
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length, nips back sharply at middle stump and catches the inside half of the bat as he shapes to power it through the off side
good length outside off, goes at it on the up and opens the face at the last moment to get it past short third man
good length at middle stump, pushes forward, inside edge onto pad and straight to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length, catches the pads as he tries to flick it and flies to the keeper
fuller ball, drilled towards mid-on
short of a length outside off, stays in the crease and defends to the off side
short ball, gets up considerably and called a wide
angled in to the right-hander and the ball cuts in sharply after landing which takes it further down the leg side
short of good length, punched back to the bowler
fuller this time, changes up the length and it is clipped to short midwicket
there comes the short delivery. Banged in on Taylor's body, the batsman does well to nudge it with shoft hands after riding the bounce as the ball drops short of the fielder at forward short leg
cutting back in slightly but enough width on offer outside off and Taylor opens the bat face to run it down to third man
tries to cut but too close to the body to pull that off effectively and he chops it hard into the pad before the ball rolls into the off side

slower length ball, and Taylor has edged behind here. Pokes tentatively at this one and tries to open the bat face but gets an outside edge. Gets a feather and the ball goes to the wicketkeeper. There is uncertainty whether it has carried or not. Taylor begins to walk off and soft signal is out but it really is touch and go. Seems like it has bounced just before the glove and the umpires refer it upstairs. Replays are conclusive enough and the decision is not out

tries to cut but this is again too close to cut. Boy is Taylor struggling here. They have asked for a review of the lbw. Not out was the decision. The ball cuts back in from short of good length and raps Taylor on the back thigh. Seems like impact is outside off. Replays show there is no bat involved and ball-tracking says impact is outside off
short of good length outside off, comes on at a nice height and it is punched elegantly off the backfoot to sweeper cover
good length outside off, presses forward and defends this to mid-on
length on off, chops his front foot defence and the ball goes towards point
good length ball, cuts back in sharply and Guptill defends solidly from the crease back to the bowler
short of good length and angling down the leg side, de Kock flings himself to his left to collect it
length ball, good attacking line, angling in on the stumps, stays in the crease and calmly turns it away to midwicket
optimistic appeal for lbw from Morris but that is heading down leg. Angled in on middle and nipping in to rap the pad as Taylor misses the flick. No chance of that being given
comes forward to push this fullish length ball and drills it off the inner part of the blade to midwicket

misses the flick as he is hurried by the pace on that delivery. Gets slightly big on him also after landing on a length and Taylor wears it on the pad as he jumps up and tries to turn it into the leg side

releases some of the pressure that had been building up on Taylor. Capitalises on this half-volley outside off and lofts it through mid-off. Places it well and gets it to the right of the fielder there and the ball goes on the bounce and over the boundary
back of a length at off stump, tails back ins lightly, he bends his back knee sligthly, the rest of him in full shape as he pummels it over the square leg boundary
short and wide outside off, chopped to deep cover
vintage Taylor! Good length outside off, walks two steps across the stumps and hoicks it over the midwicket boundary to bring up his fifty. Monster hit.
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it
bouncer at middle stump, takes his eyes off the ball and swivels as he goes for the hook, but catches it flush on the helmet and it floats to midwicket who takes a catch
short ball, sitting up nicely for Taylor who swivels around with a pull and gets in front of the square leg umpire
back of a length on leg stump, defended down the pitch off the backfoot
good length ball, knocks it to mid-on for a quick single
short ball, aimed at the ribs. Gets considerable bounce but Taylor does well to nudge it along the ground to fine leg as he gets up and drops his wrists

lofts one straight down the ground and what an effort from AB de Villiers at mid-off. Flings himself full length to his right and had he snaffled that, it would have been one of the best catches in recent memory. Guptill lofted it straight down the ground and de Villiers just came running out of nowhere but could not get to it. De Villiers had to first run quite some distance to his right, which he does and puts in a full-length dive and gets his hands to it but cannot hold on to it. 150 for Guptill and he gets a standing ovation

full and angling in on the pads and that is a monster hit. Is that the shot of the night or what! Guptill lofts it over long-on and it goes miles into the night sky and probably goes and sits on the roof
fuller ball outside off, defended to cover-point
short of a length, angling in on off from around the wicket and he nudges it very late past the wicketkeeper
short ball, tries to pull but goes through with the shot early and wears it on the shoulder
not too long ago he was struggling to put bat to ball and now he is flaying them. Fetches a mighty slog from outside off and the ball goes screaming into the deep midwicket boundary
back of a length and on the pads, whipped to fine leg on the up
short of a length and angling in, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket and they jog the single
googly, picks it and nudges it with the turn to fine leg
gives it too much air and bowls a low full toss on leg and Guptill gets down to paddle sweep it to fine leg. The ball is pulled back just before the boundary
loopy pitched up ball on leg stump, blocked off the front foot back to the bowler
short of good length, comes on flat and straight and Taylor knocks it to midwicket
nicely flighted on middle stump channel, drills it out to covers

and as soon as the fielder comes in, he has fallen for it. Comes down the track to this full toss and it is dipping. He tries to loft it over mid-on as he sees the fielder coming in but with the ball dipping on him, cannot make good connection. Ends up chipping a straightforward catch to the fielder there
shuffles across to this length ball and stabs it towards extra cover
full and wide, tries to carve it over the off side. Gets it slightly off the bottom part of the bat as he frees his arms at the sight of width. The ball goes over covers and into the boundary
good length, pitching on leg and middle, defended quietly back to the bowler
tries to drag this from outside off and slog it. It's quite wide and he is not close to it, ends up dragging it to mid-on

chipped straight down the ground, over the bowler's head. And he could have nearly been gone there. But it's just Guptill's night. Everything he tries is working in his favour. This was too full and Guptill could not get right on top of it. Lofts it and gets good elevation but not the distance. Du Plessis runs across to his right from long-off and dives but the ball drops short
good length on the pads, flicked to long leg

again short of the fielder at long-off. Tries to pull this short of good length ball but Tahir gets it to spin a good distance outside off and Guptill drags it to long-off. Brilliant fielding by the fielder and the throw is fired to Tahir who collects it but dislodges the bails with his hands as he throws the ball. Guptill was on the line when the bails came off and he would have been gone
full ball, driven to mid-off who throws it at the striker's end and Guptill is pretty sore and cannot stretch. Does not drag the bat. De Kock collects it but Guptill makes it back
googly, Guptill picks it and slogs it powerfully over deep midwicket. Long way into the grassbanks
and that is Guptill's 11th six. Pitched up right on the stumps, in the slot for Guptill who gets the front leg out of the way and lofts it straight down the ground

luck favours Guptill right till the very end. Guptill tries to slog this pitched up ball but he skews it off the leading edge as the ball goes past covers. De Villiers runs back and puts in a dive and again the ball falls in front of him. And they have enough time to come back for the second
